body_html:
This behavior is expected.

The easiest way to understand why is to assume that dataset construction is "by value". So when dataset = Dataset.zip((dataset_A, dataset_B)) is called, the dataset_A passed as the first argument will be independent of the dataset_A used to create dataset_B.
body_text:
This behavior is expected.
The easiest way to understand why is to assume that dataset construction is "by value". So when dataset = Dataset.zip((dataset_A, dataset_B)) is called, the dataset_A passed as the first argument will be independent of the dataset_A used to create dataset_B.
body:
This behavior is expected.

The easiest way to understand why is to assume that dataset construction is "by value". So when `dataset = Dataset.zip((dataset_A, dataset_B))` is called, the `dataset_A` passed as the first argument will be independent of the `dataset_A` used to create `dataset_B`.
